articles.title: 13th National Meeting of Educators Held
articles.content:
13th National Meeting of Educators Held
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The 13th National Meeting of Educators was held here Friday.
					 The meeting marked a historic landmark in eternally glorifying President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il's Juche-based idea on education and their leadership exploits and bringing about a drastic turn in education as it was held in such a stirring period when the universal 12-year compulsory education began to be in force and a great heyday is being ushered in for the building of a highly civilized socialist nation.
					
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, Choe Ryong Hae, Vice-Premieres Kim Yong Jin and Ri Mu Yong, exemplary teachers who contributed to the development of education in the past period, teachers who volunteered to work at schools on islands and in forefront areas and remote mountain villages, couples of teachers, families of educators and other officials of merit in the field of education and officials in Pyongyang and local areas and the relevant fields.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Make a Revolution in Education in the New Century to Glorify Our Country as the One of Education and a Power of Talents" was conveyed by Choe Thae Bok, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, at the meeting.
					
					 Kim Jong Un said in his work that the President set forth the original idea and theory on socialist education and successfully embodied them and thus set an example of the Juche-oriented and popular socialist education for the first time in history.
					
					 He recalled in his work that Kim Jong Il consistently adhered to the President's idea and line of attaching importance to education, channeled big efforts into the educational work even in the most difficult period of the Korean revolution, thus energetically leading the work to exalt the dignity of the country at the highest level by dint of cutting-edge science and technology.
					
					 Noting the officials and teachers in the field education, who are responsible for the educational work, have not properly performed their responsibility and role, Kim Jong Un referred to the serious consequences entailed by the wrong viewpoint and work style of officials and educators who failed to make devoted efforts for the development of the educational work as befitting its masters while underrating the importance of education.
					
					 The WPK has decided to make a fresh revolution in education to remain true to the President and Kim Jong Il's idea of attaching importance to education and their leadership exploits, consolidate the eternal foundation of the Juche revolution and make a leap forward in the drive for building a rich and powerful nation, Kim Jong Un noted, adding:
					
					 "Let Us Make a Revolution in Education in the New Century to Glorify Our Country as the One of Education and a Power of Talents!" -- This is the militant slogan put up by the WPK at present.
					
					 The goal to be attained by the revolution in education in the new century is to turn the country into a power of socialist education in the 21st century by bringing up all school youth and children as reliable pillars for the building of a thriving nation and educating all the people to be well versed in science and technology.
					
					 An important task facing the revolution in education in the new century is to round off the educational system and improve the guidance and management of the educational work in order to successfully train talents of new type required by the era.
					
					 The educational work should be guided and managed in such a manner as to fully ensure the state's unified guidance over the educational work and train more able talents required by the era and the situation by increasing the independence and responsibility of educational institutions and local areas.
					
					 The education in the age of knowledge-based economy should not be the one for letting students learn existing knowledge but it should be developed in the direction of putting its contents on a practical, comprehensive and modern basis so that students may grasp faster new and useful knowledge and more successfully apply them in practice.
					
					 All the fields should regard the educational work as part of their work, always pay deep attention to it and help solve the issues arising in the field of education in a responsible manner."
					
					  He underlined the need for the teachers to make sincere efforts and devote all their energies and wisdom to helping the students become world-famous inventors and scientists for our country, our motherland, and study hard with an ambition and hope to become pillars of the country and thus acquire a wealth of knowledge.
					
					 He called on all officials and educators to devote all their wisdom and energies to implementing the party's policy on making a revolution in education, well aware of their important mission in carrying out the revolution in education in the new century.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin made a report.
					
					 He called upon all educators and officials to bring about a revolutionary turn in the educational work and take the lead in the drive to thus usher in a great heyday of the Juche-based education.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Sweden Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Sweden Appointed
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kang Yong Dok was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Sweden, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: Malaysian King Hopes for Peace, Progress and Prosperity of Korean People
articles.content:
Malaysian King Hopes for Peace, Progress and Prosperity of Korean People
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kang Chol, DPRK ambassador to Malaysia, presented his credentials to Malaysian King Al-Sultan Almutasimu Billahi Muhibbudin Tuanku Alhaj Abdul Halim Muadzam Shah Ibni Al-Marhum Sultan Badlishah on September 2.
					 Malaysia and the DPRK have cooperated with each other in various fields, having the sincere and friendly relations, the king said, hoping that these relations would grow stronger in the future.
					
					 He hoped for peace, progress and prosperity of the Korean people.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on September 3.
					 The message said:
					
					 I am very pleased to extend my sincere congratulations to Your Excellency and your people on behalf of the Syrian Arab people and on my own behalf on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK and wish Your Excellency good health and happiness and the friendly people of your country bigger progress and prosperity.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I affirm my will to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in conformity with the common interests of the two peoples.
					
					 Please accept my highest tribute.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indian President
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Pranab Mukherjee, president of the Republic of India, on September 4.
					 In the message the president said on behalf of the government and people of India he extended warm greetings and congratulations to His Excellency Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 India and the DPRK have long-standing relations based on friendship and cooperation, the message said.
					
					 It expressed the conviction that the close relations between the two countries would advance purposefully in the mutual interests of the two peoples.
					
					 It wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Pakistani President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Pakistani President
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Mamnoon Hussain, president of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, on August 26.
					 The president said in the message that he was honored with the privilege to extend warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the auspicious national day of the DPRK.
					
					 He said he was sure that the mutual cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK successes.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Portuguese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Portuguese President
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Anibal Cavaco Silva, president of the Portuguese Republic, on August 18.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend congratulations to Your Excellency on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK and sincerely wish the people of the DPRK progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Nigerian President
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Goodluck Ebele Jonathan, president and commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, on Sept. 2.
					 The message said:
					
					 I, on behalf of the government and people of the Federal Republic of Nigeria and on my own behalf, offer sincere congratulations to Your Excellency and the great people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 66th anniversary of the founding of the country.
					
					 The government and people of the DPRK have thoroughly applied the Juche philosophy to their struggle for defending the sovereignty of the country and achieving the economic development and the peaceful reunification of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 We the two countries have strengthened the political and economic relations, conducted brisk exchange and shared the view on the issues of mutual concern in the international arena for nearly four decades.
					
					 I hope that the bilateral economic cooperation and cooperative relations will grow stronger and the exchange more brisk on this significant occasion marking the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Extending once again warm congratulations to Your Excellency on the occasion of the 66th anniversary of the DPRK, I sincerely wish that the bilateral ties will grow stronger in all fields and everything will go well in your country.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Ethiopian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Ethiopian President
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Mulatu Teshome, president of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, on August 22.
					 The message said:
					
					 I am very pleased to extend the warmest congratulations to Your Excellency, and through Your Excellency, to the government and people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia and on my own behalf.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I sincerely wish Your Excellency happiness all the time and the people of the DPRK peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Greeting to Kim Jong Un from President of Myanmar
articles.content:
Greeting to Kim Jong Un from President of Myanmar
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Thein Sein, president of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar, on September 3.
					 The message said:
					
					 I, on behalf of the people of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar and on my own behalf, extend our warm congratulations and best wishes to Your Excellency, and through Your Excellency, to the people of the DPRK on the occasion of the auspicious 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 I most sincerely wish Your Excellency happiness and successes for the steady progress and prosperity of the DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Regional Association of General Association of Koreans in China
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Regional Association of General Association of Koreans in China
Beijing, September 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting for adopting a message of greeting to supreme leader Kim Jong Un to be sent by the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK took place at the DPRK embassy in Beijing on Saturday.
					 Present there were the chairman of the regional association and Korean nationals in China.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 A message of greeting to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Reception Given by Chongryon
articles.content:
Reception Given by Chongryon
Tokyo, September 6 (KNS-KCNA) -- The Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) gave a reception at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Sept. 5 on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Present there were vice-chairpersons of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, the chairman of the Central Audit Committee of Chongryon, department directors of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, chairpersons of the Chongryon headquarters in the Kanto area, leading officials of organizations and enterprises of Chongryon and Korean commercial workers in Japan.
					
					 Present there on invitation were various personages of Japan, foreign ambassadors to Japan, representatives of international bodies in Tokyo and foreign correspondents.
					
					 Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, made a speech at the reception.
					
					 He said that the flames for creating the Korean speed are being flared up in all fields for building a thriving nation and a highly civilized nation and eye-opening successes achieved in the drive to improve the standard of people's living in the DPRK thanks to the wise guidance and energetic field guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He noted that Chongryon would together with the homeland continue ushering in a new heyday of the movement of Koreans in Japan and make every possible effort to boost the friendship between the DPRK and Japan.
					
					 The military tensions on the Korean peninsula are ascribable to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and military pressure and provocation against it, he said.
					
					 He hoped that the agreements on implementing the DPRK-Japan Pyongyang Declaration and improving bilateral relations which were made at the DPRK-Japan inter-governmental talks in May would be sincerely carried out.

articles.title: Reception Given for Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Reception Given for Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A reception arranged by Marshal Kim Jong Un was given at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Saturday in welcome of the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 Present there on invitation were the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan headed by Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and Koreans in Japan staying in the DPRK.
					
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yang Gon, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop made a speech at the reception.
					
					 Kim Jong Un provided a reception for the congratulatory group by reflecting the mind of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, Yang said.
					
					 The embrace of Kim Jong Un who is brightly glorifying Chongryon before the world with his extraordinary leadership and noble compatriotic feelings is the one of great love and eternal motherland in which Chongryon and Koreans in Japan will live generation after generation, entrusting their destiny and future to it, he noted.
					
					 Ho Jong Man spoke next:
					
					 The group's visit to the homeland is fruition of the paternal love of Kim Jong Un, who takes special care of Chongryon and puts forward it as a member of the same family just as Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il did.
					
					 The officials of Chongryon and other Koreans in Japan have turned out in the vigorous struggle to usher in a new heyday of the movement of the Koreans in Japan with the steadfast faith that as long as they are under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, they are sure to emerge victorious.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un from Chinese, Japanese
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Kim Jong Un from Chinese, Japanese
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received floral baskets from the family of Zhang Weihua, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, and Professor Emeritus Kazuyoshi Hishiki at Hiroshima Shudo University of Japan on Saturday with the approach of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.

articles.title: Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan to celebrate the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Saturday.
					 It laid bouquets before the statues and paid tribute in the humblest reverence to the peerless great men who performed undying exploits for the development of Chongryon.

articles.title: Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Arrives
articles.content:
Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Arrives
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan arrived here Saturday to celebrate the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK. It is headed by Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.
					 It was greeted at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yang Gon, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned. 
					
					 The members of the group paid tribute to the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, missing them very much.
					
					 Citizens warmly welcomed the group with compatriotic feelings, waving bouquets.

articles.title: Yamanashi Prefectural Delegation for Japan-DPRK Friendship Here
articles.content:
Yamanashi Prefectural Delegation for Japan-DPRK Friendship Here
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A Yamanashi Prefectural delegation for Japan-DPRK friendship led by Yasunobu Kanemaru, president of the Television Yamanashi Co., Ltd. arrived here on Saturday.
					 The Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries hosted a reception in honor of the delegation on the same day.

articles.title: EU-Asia Centre Delegation Here
articles.content:
EU-Asia Centre Delegation Here
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the EU-Asia Centre led by Director Fraser Cameron arrived here on Saturday.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Leaves for Foreign Countries
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Leaves for Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, left here Saturday to visit Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Italy and Mongolia.

articles.title: Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected in Chongjin
articles.content:
Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected in Chongjin
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il were erected in Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The erection of the statues of the great men born of Heaven in the city is a manifestation of the steadfast faith and will of the people in the province to hold in high esteem them as the eternal sun of Juche and carry forward and accomplish the great cause of Mt. Paektu under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 An unveiling ceremony took place on Saturday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Hyon Yong Chol and other senior party, state and army officials, officials concerned, service personnel, officials, labor innovators and shock brigade members who contributed to erecting the statues and working people, youth and students in the province.
					
					 Also present there on invitation were staff members of foreign consulates general in the city and other foreigners.
					
					 The statues were unveiled by senior officials of the party, state and army and the province.
					
					 Laid before the statues was a floral basket in the name of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also placed before the statues was a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Placed there were floral baskets in the name of the party and power bodies, working people's organizations, institutions and enterprises, factories and farms in the province, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, universities, etc.
					
					 All the participants paid tribute to the statues in the humblest reverence.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, made an unveiling address.
					
					 He recalled that the province is associated with the leadership feats performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung left giant footprints for the victory of the anti-Japanese war in the province from the days he  crossed the River Tuman on October 1, Juche 19 (1930), mounted Turu Hill in Onsong County and formed the first party organization in the homeland till he accomplished the cause of national liberation.
					
					 He visited hundreds of units from the days he provided his first field guidance to the province after the liberation of the country, clearly indicating the tasks to be fulfilled by the province and ways to do so and wisely leading the struggle to carry them out.
					
					 Kim Jong Il unfolded a new history of changes in the province through his energetic field guidance till the last moments of his revolutionary life.
					
					 A socialist fairyland has been built in the province, its production is being reenergized and songs of happiness of the people are heard. This eye-opening reality is the precious fruition of the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The speaker called upon the officials and other people in the province to firmly defend and eternally glorify the revolutionary idea and feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as befitting descendants of Kim Il Sung and soldiers and disciples of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The participants went round the statues, being briefed on them.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Choe Chun Guk Commemorated
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Choe Chun Guk Commemorated
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A national meeting took place at the Central Youth Hall on Saturday to commemorate the centenary of birth of revolutionary martyr Choe Chun Guk.
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Phyong Hae, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army, persons of merit, bereaved family members and other working people in the city.
					
					 Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, made a report.
					
					 The reporter said that Choe Chun Guk, who was born in a poor farmer family in Onsong County, North Hamgyong Province on September 6, Juche 3 (1914), was a revolutionary soldier and loyal military and political official who performed feats in the history of the Songun revolution of Juche, holding in high esteem President Kim Il Sung with arms of the revolution.
					
					 Choe had the honor of meeting Kim Il Sung and receiving a precious instruction from him for the first time after the latter's advance into the Onsong area with a plan for building the northern border area along the River Tuman into a strategic base for the armed struggle in September, Juche 19 (1930), the reporter noted, adding: This occasioned a radical turn in his life and revolutionary struggle.
					
					 After joining the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army in the spring of Juche 21 (1932), Choe bravely fought, assuming the responsibilities of a squad leader, company political instructor, regiment commander, regiment political commissar and separate brigade political commissar under the particular loving care and trust of Kim Il Sung and thus made a great contribution to achieving the historic cause of national liberation.
					
					 After the liberation of the country, he devoted himself to the founding of the WPK and the building of regular armed forces, holding the important posts of inspector of North Hamgyong Province and branch chief of the Security Officers Training Centre, true to the line of Kim Il Sung on building a new country. During the Fatherland Liberation War, Choe performed heroic feats as a division commander by displaying matchless devotion and self-sacrificing spirit in the struggle to implement the strategic intention of Supreme Commander Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Brief as Choe's life was, the loyalty, bravery, heroism and noble mental and moral traits displayed by him in upholding the party and leader are remembered by the Korean people still today when generations were replaced by new ones and the revolution advanced far.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of Choe Chun Guk
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of Choe Chun Guk
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the bust of revolutionary martyr Choe Chun Guk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Saturday to mark his 100th birth anniversary. 
					 Seen standing before the bust was a wreath sent by supreme leader Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Phyong Hae, Vice-Premiers Kim Yong Jin and Ri Chol Man, officials of the party and armed forces organs and national institutions, service personnel, bereaved family members and citizens. 
					
					 Laid before the bust amid the playing of the wreath-laying music were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet. 
					
					 Also placed were wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army, party and power bodies in Pyongyang and others. 
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute in memory of Choe Chun Guk.

articles.title: Harvest Moon Day, Traditional Festival of Korea
articles.content:
Harvest Moon Day, Traditional Festival of Korea
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Harvest Moon Day is a traditional festival of the Korean nation.
					 According to historical records, the Koreans have visited their ancestral graves before anything else on the day every year, tending them with care and holding memorial services with various dishes made of new crops.
					
					 Then they would enjoy the day significantly, taking special dishes and playing such folk games as Korean wrestling, tug of war, archery and swing. In the evening they spent a pleasant time seeing the full moon.
					
					 Harvest Moon Day for this year falls on Sept. 8.

articles.title: 9th Pyongyang Int'l Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition to Be Held
articles.content:
9th Pyongyang Int'l Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition to Be Held
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The 9th Pyongyang International Scientific and Technological Book Exhibition will be held at the Grand People's Study House from September 16 to 18.
					 The exhibition will bring together many organizations from different countries and regions of the world and international bodies. There will be on display books and information on latest science and technology.
					
					 The exhibition will contribute to boosting the exchange and cooperation in science and technology among countries.

articles.title: FIFA Women's Football Coaching Course Held in DPRK
articles.content:
FIFA Women's Football Coaching Course Held in DPRK
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A FIFA women's football coaching course took place here on September 2-6.
					 It drew women football coaches from local sports teams and teachers of the Pyongyang International Football School and juvenile sports schools.
					
					 The course, held in theory and practical, was officiated by Monika Staab who is FIFA instructor and coach.
					
					 The theory dealt with systems and analysis of play, group/team tactics, role and instruction abilities of coaches, etc. The practical covered techniques leading to skill practice game, attacking principles, small sided games and others.
					
					 Kim Kyong Hui, a football coach of the Amnokgang Sports Team, told KCNA that the course helped get aware of training methods suitable to the trend of world football development.

articles.title: DPRK Witnesses Unusual Summer Weather
articles.content:
DPRK Witnesses Unusual Summer Weather
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Unusual weather was witnessed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea this summer.
					 According to a weather expert, the country observes some 583 mm rainfalls in summer usually, 60 percent of the annual precipitation. But, this summer saw 358 mm rainfalls, with 75 mm in June, 208 mm in July and 75 mm in August.
					
					 Meanwhile, 15 rounds of hail fall were observed in Pyongyang and some east and west coastal areas, which are considered to have been common in early summer and autumn in the country. In Samjiyon County, Ryanggang Province, frost fell untimely on August 10.
					
					 The unusual weather was ascribable to El Nino, which stayed above the Korean Peninsula and its surrounding areas, causing high pressure in the East Asian region.

articles.title: Turf Cultivation Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Turf Cultivation Brisk in DPRK
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Big efforts are paid to tending lawns built with new species of turf in all parts of the DPRK, including Pyongyang.
					 Turfs were replanted and seeds re-sown on patches where turfs were washed away by downpour. Also, a work goes on to manure and trim turfs.
					
					 Meanwhile, the local people have turned out in a campaign to prevent turf from drought.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats for Nation Building
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats for Nation Building
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung is a great patriot as he built a genuine country for the people in Korea, for the first time in its history of 5 000 years.
					 The situation of Korea was very complicated just after its liberation from Japan's colonial rule. It was divided into two parts, the north and the south, with the U.S. troops' occupation of south Korea and the imperialist reactionary forces made desperate attempts to hinder the Korean people's efforts for building a new country.
					
					 Under such situation, Kim Il Sung set forth the Juche-based idea and theory on state building. In his historic speech "On Building the Party, State and Armed Forces in the Liberated Homeland", he advanced the line of nation building to be adhered to by the Korean people in building a new country. 
					
					 Then he energetically guided the work to build a people-centered country in the northern part of Korea, arousing all the people's patriotic zeal to smash the imperialist reactionaries' obstructive moves.
					
					 He defined the form of political power as a people's power that defends the interests of the working masses, including workers, peasants and intellectuals, and stepped up the preparations for solving the issue of power. 
					
					 To this end, he established the Provisional People's Committee of North Korea, a reference to people's democratic power carrying out the tasks of the anti-imperialist, anti-feudal democratic revolution, and enforced democratic reforms in all aspects.
					
					 On the basis of such solid foundations for building an independent and sovereign state, he founded the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on September 9, Juche 37 (1948). 
					
					 The birth of the DPRK was a historic event as it made the Korean people masters of a full-fledged sovereign state.

articles.title: Minju Joson Ridicules Wordplay of S. Korean Chief Executive
articles.content:
Minju Joson Ridicules Wordplay of S. Korean Chief Executive
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The chief executive of south Korea recently said it proposed "dialogue" and called for accumulating "experience of cooperation", "meeting with each other and opening the way of building confidence for understanding".
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Saturday says:
					
					 She tried to give impression that she was interested in the north-south dialogue and improvement of relations between them. But it is a trick to mislead the public opinion at home and abroad.
					
					 The commentary goes on: 
					
					 It is ridiculous for her to make such remarks as she blocked all sorts of cooperation, exchanges and dialogue between the north and the south by taking the "May 24 step".
					
					 Her wordplay was to mislead the public opinion, cover up her treacherous anti-reunification nature, evade the responsibility for bedeviling the north-south relations and calm down the spirit for actions mounting among the people. 
					
					 However, her poor trick can not work. It reveals her traitorous anti-reunification nature full of hostility toward the fellow countrymen. It will only show who is barring the north-south relations from getting improved and make the people's anti-regime struggle fiercer. 
					
					 If she is truly interested in the north-south dialogue and improvement of the relations between the north and the south, she should not resort to the poor trick but stop the nuclear war drills against the north in league with outside forces and make a bold decision to implement the north-south agreements. If she continues to fool the public opinion at home and abroad with wordplay, the nation will never pardon her.

articles.title: Punishment of Those Responsible for Ferry Accident Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Punishment of Those Responsible for Ferry Accident Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The Measure Committee of the Families of Victims, Missing Persons and Survivors of the Ferry Sewol Sinking Accident of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Sept. 3 at which it urged not to downplay the responsibility for the ferry accident, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 It said that the accident did not occur due to the mistake of the captain alone.
					
					 It called for thoroughly probing the truth about the accident and punishing those responsible for it.
					
					 It accused the "Saenuri Party" of refusing to institute a special law granting the right to investigate and indict those responsible for the accident though it is aware of the limitations of the special inspection system.

articles.title: U.S. Moves for MD Rejected in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Moves for MD Rejected in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The Committee for Reconciliation and Reunification of the south Korean Council of Christian Churches made public a statement on Sept. 4 in protest against the U.S. moves for establishing a missile defense system, according to Thongil News, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 The U.S. is mulling deploying THAAD in south Korea, the statement said.
					
					 The deployment of THAAD in south Korea would escalate military tensions on the Korean peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia and ratchet up antagonism and conflict, it noted, demanding the "government" lift "the May 24 step" and stop military exercises as they adversely affect the peace on the peninsula.

articles.title: Police Crackdown on Pro-reunification Activist under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Police Crackdown on Pro-reunification Activist under Fire in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean police forcibly searched the house of Yun Ki Ha, who has looked after legal support for the victims of the "Security Law", on Sept. 2, according to Jaju Minbo, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 The security investigation team of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency broke into his house and confiscated documents, books, etc. that day. 
					
					 The fascist police took such action to gather information on the operation of the organization of victims of the SL, its linkage with pro-reunification movement organizations and funds for Yun's activities.
					
					 The present regime is persisting in the suppression under the pretext of security, Yun said, demanding an immediate stop to the crackdown aimed to stamp out the pro-reunification movement.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work off Press in Russia
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Make Our Country Richer and More Powerful, True to the Intention of the Great Leader" was brought out in booklet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on Sept. 1.
					 The work, published on Dec. 31, Juche 83 (1994), indicates the tasks and ways to build our country, our motherland, to be richer and more powerful.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Brazil
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Brazil
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A seminar on leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution" took place in Brazil on August 28 to mark the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 Present there were personages of the Brazilian Centre for the Study of the Juche Idea and masses.
					
					 Gabriel Goncalves Martinez, chairman of the center, explained the main contents of the work at the seminar.
					
					 Then, speeches were made by various personages.
					
					 The speakers said that the Songun revolutionary line and the Songun politics are a scientific and revolutionary line and political mode most correctly reflecting the demand of the times and the developing revolution.
					
					 They highly praised Kim Jong Il for defending the sovereignty of the country and nation under the banner of Songun and Marshal Kim Jong Un for having made eye-opening successes in the building of a thriving socialist nation with his Songun leadership.
					
					 They said they would extend invariable support and solidarity to the struggle of the Korean people who are advancing under the unfurled banner of Songun.

articles.title: Day of Songun Celebrated in Pakistan, Angola
articles.content:
Day of Songun Celebrated in Pakistan, Angola
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in Pakistan and round-table talks in Angola between August 19 and 25 on the occasion of the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 A reporter and speakers including the general secretary of the Sind State Committee of the Pakistan Awami National Party, the secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association said that the DPRK could turn into a political, ideological and military power which achieved single-minded unity and the Korean People's Army grow to be the invincible revolutionary armed forces thanks to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Songun in the DPRK is being given a steady continuity thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un, they said, adding that under his leadership the might of the DPRK is being strengthened day by day and the Korean people are enjoying a happy life.
					
					 They expressed belief that the Korean people would register successes in building a thriving nation and reunifying the country as they are led by him.
					
					 The general director of a company of Angola said he was haunted by the question how the DPRK, not a large country, is dynamically advancing, saying what it should do to the U.S. The round-table talks offered him an opportunity to know clearly that the DPRK is doing so because leader Kim Jong Il strengthened its military muscle in every way with his Songun leadership from long ago, he noted.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would in the future, too, register bigger successes in building a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un who is identical to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Songun Marked by Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Day of Songun Marked by Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Special write-ups were posted by foreign organizations on their websites between August 21 and 23 on the occasion of the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il and Songun politics" illustrated with his photo.
					
					 The article said Kim Jong Il provided his first field guidance for his Songun revolutionary leadership to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960.
					
					 Under his Songun leadership that over the last more than half a century since then, the DPRK firmly defended its sovereignty and dignity in the confrontation with the U.S. styling itself the only superpower, the article noted.
					
					 It said that he fully displayed his traits as the peerless illustrious commander against the U.S. ceaseless provocation moves targeting the DPRK such as the U.S. armed spy ship Pueblo case in January, 1968 and the U.S. large-size spy plane EC-121 incident in April, 1969.
					
					 The Group for the Study of Juche Philosophy and Songun Politics of Malta posted articles titled "Immortal Songun leadership feats" and "Day of Songun in DPRK".
					
					 The articles praised him for training the KPA into the matchless army and ushering in a new prosperity for the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The South African Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in articles including the one titled "By dint of Songun" said that the DPRK could win one victory after another in the political and military standoff with the U.S. thanks to his Songun leadership.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article titled "Father of soldiers".

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente indio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente indio
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el dia 4 el Presidente de la Republica de la India, Pranab Mukherjee.
					El texto sigue:
					
					Con motivo del dia de fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, extiendo a Vd, al gobierno y al pueblo de la RPDC las calurosas felicitaciones en representacion del gobierno y pueblo de la India.
					
					La India y la RPDC tienen largas relaciones basadas en la amistad y la cooperacion.
					
					Estoy convencido de que las estrechas relaciones entre dos paises avanzaran con proposito conforme a los intereses mutuos de ambos pueblos.
					
					Deseo de todo corazon a Su Excelencia buena salud y felicidad y al amistoso pueblo de la RPDC el progreso y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente pakistani
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente pakistani
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el 26 de agosto el Presidente de la Republica Islamica de Pakistan, Mamnoon Hussain.
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					Tengo el privilegio de enviar mis calidas felicitaciones a Su Excelencia con motivo del jubiloso Dia Nacional de la RPDC.
					
					Estoy convencido de que la cooperacion entre nuestros dos paises se fortalecera y se desarrollara mas en el futuro.
					
					Deseo buena salud y felicidad a Su Excelencia y exitos al amistoso pueblo de la RPDC.
					
					Reciba el testimonio de mi mas alta consideracion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente portugues
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion del presidente portugues
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le dirigiera el 18 de agosto el Presidente de la Republica de Portugal, Anibal Cavaco Silva.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Con motivo del dia de fundacion de la RPDC, felicito a Su Excelencia y deseo de todo corazon el progreso y la prosperidad al pueblo de la RPDC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente nigeriano
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente nigeriano
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Jong Un, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el dia 2 el Presidente de la Republica Federal de Nigeria y Comandante en Jefe de las fuerzas armadas, Goodluck Ebele Jonathan.
					El texto va como sigue: 
					
					Con motivo del 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, quisiera hacerles llegar a Su Excelencia y al pueblo de la gran Republica Popular Democratica de Corea las sinceras felicitaciones en nombre del gobierno y pueblo de la Republica Federal de Nigeria y en el mio propio. 
					
					En el pasado, el gobierno y pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea vinieron materializando estrictamente la filosofia Juche en la lucha por defender la soberania del pais, lograr el desarrollo economico y realizar la reunificacion pacifica de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					Durante casi 40 anos, nuestros dos paises vinieron fortaleciendo las relaciones politicas y economicas, activando el intercambio y compartiendo las opiniones sobre los asuntos de interes mutuo en los escenarios internacionales.
					
					Aprovechando esta oportunidad significativa de acoger el dia de fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, deseo que se fortalezcan mas la cooperacion economica y las relaciones de colaboracion entre nuestros dos paises y se active mas el intercambio. 
					
					En ocasion del 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, le expreso una vez mas a Su Excelencia mis calidas felicitaciones y deseo de todo corazon que las relaciones entre nuestros dos paises se consoliden mas en todos los dominios y marchen bien todas las cosas en su pais.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente etiope
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente etiope
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Jong Un, recibio mensaje de felicitacion que le enviara el 22 de agosto el Presidente de la Republica Federal Democratica de Etiopia, Mulatu Teshome.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Con motivo del 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC, tengo el gran placer de enviar las mas calidas felicitaciones a Su Excelencia y por su conducto, al gobierno y pueblo de la RPDC en nombre del gobierno y pueblo de la RFDE y en el mio propio.
					
					Aprovechando esta oportunidad, deseo que Su Excelencia sea siempre feliz y el pueblo de la RPDC tenga la paz y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente de Myanmar
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de felicitacion de presidente de Myanmar
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Jong Un, recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que el enviara el dia 3 el Presidente de la Republica de la Union de Myanmar, Thein Sein.
					El mensaje sigue:
					
					En ocasion del jubiloso dia, 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la RPDC, extiendo a Su Excelencia y por su conducto, al pueblo de la RPDC, nuestra calida felicitacion y maximo voto en nombre del pueblo de la RUM y en el mio propio.
					
					Deseo de todo corazon a Su Excelencia felicidad y exitos para el incesante progreso y prosperidad de la RPDC.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia a mandataria surcoreana que elude la responsabilidad
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia a mandataria surcoreana que elude la responsabilidad
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Recientemente, la mandataria surcoreana dijo que el Sur de Corea propuso el "dialogo" con el Norte de Corea y le insto a acumular las "experiencias de cooperacion" y "sostener contactos para abrir el canal de confianza y comunicacion".
					El periodico Minju Joson, en un comentario individual de este sabado, lo califica de una artimana para inducir en error la opinion publica interna y externa hablando como si los titeres surcoreanos estuvieran interesados en el dialogo Norte-Sur y en la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas. 
					
					Lo mas ridiculo del caso es que los titeres surcoreanos vinieron impidiendo la cooperacion, el intercambio y el dialogo entre ambas partes coreanas en virtud de las "medidas del 24 de mayo" y hablan ahora atrevidamente de la "experiencia de colaboracion" y del "canal de confianza y comunicacion", ironiza el comentarista y continua: 
					
					Tales sofisterias parten del intento de ocultar su naturaleza anti-reunificacion y antinacional, eludir la culpabilidad de haber empeorado las relaciones intercoreanas y apaciguar el clima de protesta de la poblacion surcoreana.
					
					Esta dando resultados contrarios la artimana de los titeres surcoreanos.
					
					Si la mandataria surcoreana esta interesada de veras en el dialogo Norte-Sur y en la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas, debe parar los ejercicios de guerra nuclear anti-RPDC que libra con las fuerzas extranjeras y tomar la decision de cumplir los acuerdos acordados entre ambas partes coreanas.
